competencies.name: Driver conducts daily checks listed in Defect Book in a well-lit area away from main traffic routes
Driver checks First Aid box including eye wash to ensure it is complete
Driver checks the external cleanliness of the vehicle including lights, number plates , indicators and windows
Driver checks that the cab is clean and free from unauthorised items
Any defects identified and  reported to appropriate personnel
competencies.supportingText: 1. What is the procedure for reporting defects to appropriate personnel?

competencies.name: Driver wears high-visibility clothing provided by the company together with any other relevant personal protective equipment
Driver has required documentation for their load
Driver ensures that only authorised passengers ride in the vehicle and that seat belts are worn at required times
competencies.supportingText: 1. Why are unauthorised passengers not allowed to ride in the vehicle?

competencies.name: Driver ensures that employees do not ride on the back or any other part of the vehicle
competencies.supportingText: 1. Why is it important that employees do not ride on the back or any other part of the vehicle?

competencies.name: Driver ensures the safety self, the public and other road users when stopping, starting and positioning the vehicle
Driver operates vehicle safely: •following public highway traffic convention•with due consideration to others
Driver ensures that no loading takes place while the vehicle is in motion
Driver check that the vehicle is loaded safely with no over-loading or overhanging items
competencies.supportingText:
1. Why is it necessary to remove over-hanging items?
  2. Why is it necessary to check the vehicle is not over-loaded?

competencies.name: Reversing operations are conducted safely following company procedure (or as detailed in WAP9)
Driver is aware of and has undertaken training in the operation of bulk articulated trailers
competencies.supportingText: 1. What is the correct training for the operation of bulk ejector trailers?

competencies.name: Driver ensures that no unauthorised person operates the bulk articulated trailer
Driver complies with all site safety rules when on customer’s premises or tipping sites
competencies.supportingText:
1. What are the major safety rules that must be complied with on customer’s premises?
  2. What are the major safety rules that must be complied with on tipping sites?

competencies.name: Driver takes great care when reversing to a tip edge to prevent the vehicle from going over the edge

sections.name: C - Sheeting and Un-sheeting: Automatic Sheeting

competencies.name: Driver checks for any overhanging, loose or trailing contents or any material that could prevent the use of the auto-sheeting system
Driver trims the load from ground level to allow auto-sheeting
Driver uses secure lockable steps, an access platform or a fall-arrest system when trimming the load is not possible from ground level
competencies.supportingText: 1. Which types of equipment must be used if you cannot trim the load from ground level?

competencies.name: Driver ensures that correct protection procedures are followed when working from height
competencies.supportingText: 1. What is the company procedure for protecting yourself when working from height?

competencies.name: Driver informs supervisor if unable to work safely from height
competencies.supportingText: 1. What is the company procedure for informing supervisor if you are unable to work from height?

competencies.name: Driver ensures that assistance is available when using a fall-arrest system to prevent suspension trauma
competencies.supportingText: 1. Why is it important to ensure someone is with you when using a fall-arrest system?

competencies.name: Driver reports inoperable auto-sheet to supervisor at once
Driver ensures safety harness is correctly adjusted before use
competencies.supportingText: 1. How do you adjust a safety harness before use?

competencies.name: Driver follows company procedure for the checking and storage of safety harnesses
competencies.supportingText: 1. What is the company procedure for checking and storing safety harnesses?

competencies.name: Driver reports any problems over the condition and use of the safety harness to supervisor
competencies.supportingText: 1. What is the company procedure for reporting any problems over the condition or use of the safety harness to your supervisor?

competencies.name: Driver ensures that the safety harness is never used when alone
competencies.supportingText: 1. Why is it important never to use a safety harness if working alone?

competencies.name: Driver parks on firm and level ground
Driver applies the vehicle parking brake
Driver applies trailer hand brake
Driver winds down legs using stow handle
Driver switches off any air taps
Driver disconnects air/electrical lines in a logical sequence
Driver stows air/electrical lines safely and securely
Driver releases trailer locking device
Driver pulls forward slowly and checks that the trailer releases correctly and safely
Driver parks alongside the trailer
Driver checks that the hand brake is still on
Driver removes the number plate
Driver takes up a coupling position just short of the trailer
Driver checks that the height of the trailer and the height of the vehicle are compatible
Driver checks that the trailer hand brake is on
Driver checks the number plate, tyres and trailer body to ensure that it is legal to take on road
Driver reverses under the trailer until connection is made
Driver moves forward slightly to ensure connection is secure
Driver applies the vehicle parking brake
Driver secures 5th wheel or coupling locking device
Driver connects air and electrical lines in a logical sequence and switches on taps if fitted
Driver disconnects the airlines immediately if the vehicle and trailer start to move forward
Driver winds up legs using stow handle
Driver fits number plate
Driver releases hand brake
Driver ensures air pressure has built up
Driver checks lights
Driver carries out a rolling brake test
Driver does not operate the trailer in shunt mode
